document.docAuthor: Li, Yang, Achterberg, Cornelis Van & Chen, Xue-Xin
document.docTitle: Iphiaulax longinervis Li & Achterberg & Chen 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two genera Campyloneurus Szépligeti and Iphiaulax Foerster in China, with the descriptions of fourteen new species (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Braconinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two genera Campyloneurus Szépligeti and Iphiaulax Foerster in China, with the descriptions of fourteen new species (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Braconinae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 37. Iphiaulax longinervis sp. nov., ♀, holotype, habitus lateral.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 38. Iphiaulax longinervis sp. nov., ♀, holotype. a. fore wing; b. hind wing; c. mesosoma, lateral view; d. mesosoma, dorsal view; e. metasoma, dorsal view; f. hind leg, lateral view; g. head, front view; h. head, dorsal view; i. head, lateral view; j. first metasomal tergite, dorsal view; k. scapus outer side, lateral view; l. apex of antenna; m. apex of ovipositor, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This new species is very similar to
I . agraensis Cameron, 1897
, but can be separated from the latter by the following characters: head yellow with black dorsal marking not reaching eye orbits (reaching eye orbits in
I . agraensis
); metasomal tergites uniformly black (uniformly yellow); hind leg mainly black (yellow); hind wing vein 1r-m 1.1–1.2 × as long as vein SC+R1 (0.9 ×).
Description. Holotype , ♀ , length of body 15.8 mm , of fore wing 14.0 mm, of ovipositor sheath 2.0 mm.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 37.
Iphiaulax longinervis
sp. nov.
, ♀, holotype, habitus lateral.

FIGURE 38.
Iphiaulax longinervis
sp. nov.
, ♀, holotype. a. fore wing; b. hind wing; c. mesosoma, lateral view; d. mesosoma, dorsal view; e. metasoma, dorsal view; f. hind leg, lateral view; g. head, front view; h. head, dorsal view; i. head, lateral view; j. first metasomal tergite, dorsal view; k. scapus outer side, lateral view; l. apex of antenna; m. apex of ovipositor, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs . Length of fore femur: tibia: tarsus = 20: 24: 29; length of hind femur: tibia: basitarsus = 32: 55: 14; length of femur, tibia and basitarsus of hind leg 2.3, 6.9 and 3.5 × their maximum width, respectively; hind tibial spurs 0.3 and 0.5 × as long as hind basitarsus.

Variation . Length of body of female 13.1–15.8 mm , of fore wing of female 12.4–14.0 mm, and of ovipositor sheath 2.0–4.0 mm; antenna of female with 90 antennomeres; length of mesosoma 2.0 × its height; fore wing vein 1r-m 1.1 × as long as vein SC+R1; ovipositor sheath 0.14–0.32 × as long as fore wing; propodeum black; hind tibia and tarsus infuscate.
Etymology. Named after the relatively long vein 1r-m of the fore wing: “longus” and “nervis” is Latin for “long” and “sinew, vein”, respectively.
